name: Wizard Tower
description:
Building a tower is hard work. The great sorcerer has tasked you with retrieving a moon stone, but the moon is far away. You know you read in some tome about a creature of clay which will fulfill any task you set before it, perhaps they can help.

Created in 48 hours for Alakajam 7.

How To Play:
I didn't have enough time to add a tutorial in game, so I wrote it down here. If you are lost, keep reading here.

  • You control the small wizard. Use WASD or arrow keys to move or select an action from the menu on the top right.
  • When on the same tile as a resource, you can grab one with an action. The trees at ground level, and clay underground are examples of these resources.
  • You may discard a held resource if you don't need it.
  • While holding a resource, you can build rooms of your tower. After selecting the build button, a new set of buttons will appear with all the rooms you can construct with your held resource. Simply select what you want to build, and a construction site will appear.
  • You can drop resources at construction sites or storage sites using a drop action. Once a construction site holds enough resources, which is shown in the UI, it will turn into the desired room.
  • After building certain types of rooms, others may become available to construct as well.
  • Normal corridors can only get you so far. You need to use more expensive corridors when you get to high altitude.
  • Golems are key to the game. The Golem factory is constructed after a clay storage. Building one will allow you to construct Golems on available squares.
  • One a golem is built, it must be programmed. Select the teach action while sharing a space with a golem, then do any actions you wish before returning to the golem, and select Start. The golem will now copy everything you just did until you destroy it.
  • A golem will mimic every move whether or not it is successful. Moving in a direction even when it is not legal, will still program the golem with that move. (Could be useful later.)
